alert.note: Alert for Elko; Humboldt; Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 10 at 3:02AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Snow melt flooding across Humboldt County River/Creek basins... Warm afternoon temperatures will combine with an above normal higher elevation snow pack to lead to increased snowmelt runoff across portions of Humboldt County. High temperatures across the area will reach the upper 60s to lower 70s for today and Tuesday of this week. Local streams are likely to see increased daytime streamflows. Locations that will see increased runoff and flooding potential are Martin Creek, and the Little Humboldt River in Paradise Valley, McDermitt Creek near McDermitt, and the Quinn River near McDermitt. These streams have already seen increased flow rates, and this pattern is expected to continue, and flood warnings may be needed as additional snow melts. Please exercise caution around these streams and remember, do not attempt to cross flooded areas or roadways. Turn around don`t drown!
